unit. * * <<AdvancePeriod>> Advances time period by 1 unit. * <<AdvancePeriod 1>> Advances time period by 1 unit. * <<AdvancePeriod 2>> Advances time period by 2 units. * * If the current day's time boundary is exceeded then the Day Number * will also be updated. */ <<widget "advancePeriod">> \<<silently>> <<set _offset to 1>> <<set _periodsInDay to setup.PERIODS.length>> <<if $args.length > 0>> $period to ($period % _periodsInDay)>> <</if>> <</silently>>\ <</widget>> /* * <<NextMorning>> * * Advances the current Time Period to the Morning of the next day. */ <<widget "nextMorning">> Here's a quick breakdown of them, all of which can be viewed in your sidebar to the left. <span class="cash">Money</span> - Cold hard cash, I need it to keep paying you, keep paying rent, and to purchase improvements for the business. It's earned by doing casting jobs. <span class="rep">Reputation</span> - The most important stat for growth, it's how well we're known in the entertainment industry. It's crucial for casting bigger and better projects, and I can improve it by doing jobs and networking. <span class="charm">Charisma</span> - My skill at winning over and influencing people. It's not necessarily vital for work, but I'll need it to make friends and do missions. And it's also important to make auditioners feel comfortable, in a strictly professional way, of course. I can increase it by going out and socializing. <span class="good">Style</span> - How ostentacious my lifestyle is, it can only be improved by buying flashy things I don't need. Many opportunities will be locked until I reach a requisite amount. <span class="stress">Stress</span> - How close I am to being too exhausted to work. It's increased by doing jobs, and lowered by relaxing, sleeping, and socializing. There are rumors of casting directors lowering their stress by having... one-on-one time with auditioners they take a liking to. Which brings me to the next stat. <span class="notoriety">Notoriety</span> - How infamous I am for misdeeds I may or may not have done. This would increase if I were to ever abuse my position of authority and take advantage of auditioners, and the only way to decrease it is through charity work, philanthropy, or keeping my nose clean for enough time. <strong>If it ever reaches 100, our business is over,</strong> so keep an eye on it. [[You both enjoy your meals until...|mollySecondDate3]] <</if>> <<bg restaurant>>\ <img src="pics/kevin/default.jpg" class="right"> <<kevin "Molly! Is that you?">> says a voice from across the restaurant. Molly turns, and her face falls to a frown which she quickly forces into a fake smile. <<molly "Hi <em>Kevin</em>,">> Molly responds, flashing you a quick look. So this is her ex. He walks to the table, not paying you any mind. <<kevin "If I remember correctly, I think I was the one who showed you this place. So I call dibs on it,">> he jokes with a shit-eating grin. <<molly "Oh shoot, I guess you do!">> Molly politely responds. <<molly "This is my friend, $you.firstName.">> <<kevin "Hey, what's up,">> Kevin answers dispassionately. Maybe there's something to be found there.</em> You crack it open and delve into [[Shakespeare's most misogynistic play.|mack1Event2]]<<home>>\ The maiden Katherine is presented as a fiery, rude shrew who's disagreeable to the notion of being married. When a potential suitor points out he wouldn't marry such an unpleasant woman, she responds: <img src="pics/event/shrew1.jpg" class="right">\ <strong>I' faith, sir, you shall never need fear. Iwis it is not halfway to her heart. But if it were, doubt not her care should be To comb your noddle with a three-legged stool And paint your face and use you like a fool.</strong> <em>Yeah, threatening to beat you over the head with a stool sounds like something Mackenzie would do.</em> Petruchio, a proud young man who just arrived in town, takes it upon himself to "tame" and marry the woman so he can access her father's fortune. <em>Alright, I'm Petruchio and Mackenzie's Katherine. Let's skip around to how he gets the job done...</em> Act II, Scene 1. Petruchio discusses with himself how he plans to woo her. <strong>Say that she rail; why then I'll her plain She sings as sweetly as a nightingale. Say that she frown; I'll say she looks as clear As morning roses newly washed with dew. Say she be mute and will not speak a word; Then I'll commend her volubility, And say she uttereth piercing eloquence.</strong> <em>So if she talks like a bitch, he'll call her sweet. If she's silent, I'll comment on how chatty she is... Of course. Gaslighting. A tactic men have used on women for millenia.</em> In the unfolding scene, Petruchio begins by calling Katherine "Kate." Katherine tells him not to call her that, so he calls her Kate about 15 times. He turns every insult into a sexual inuenndo, at one time implying she wants him to eat her ass ([[seriously|mack1EventStinger]]), and remains relentlessly positive in the face of her anger and violence. Even though Katherine clearly hates him, Petruchio announces to everyone she's agreed to marry him, and she has no choice but to go along with it. <em>Annoy her. Make her feel crazy. Make decisions for her.</em> They marry, and Petruchio proceeds to humiliate her at her own wedding. He deprives Katherine of sleep, food, and clothing, all under the pretense he's trying to help her. <img src="pics/event/shrew2.jpg" class="left">\ <em>Break her down until she's totally reliant on me. Convince her that I'm the only one who can help.</em> In the last scene of the play, Petruchio and his pals make a bet on whose wife will come to them when summoned. Everyone's wives refuse except Katherine, who says, <strong>What is your will, sir, that you send for me.</strong> And the shrew is tamed. Took a little while, but you finally have a gameplan.
